google_reviews.author: Austin Williamson
google_reviews.review: Absolutely horrendous accommodations for students. Complete inflexibility and total managerial incompetence. After learning that I could not break my lease or transfer my lease to a third-party, the leasing office was barely tolerable during my many attempts to secure a lease take-over. One of the applicants that tried to take-over my lease grew so frustrated by the obtuseness of the leasing office that they gave up on the process entirely and looked elsewhere for their accommodations. I encourage anyone that is considering applying to lease from here to look elsewhere long and hard before realizing that this isnt even a worthy last option. Honestly youre probably better off living out of your car or on the street than living here.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Austin, this is Kailey with the Customer Service team. Thank you for the feedback. I am sorry to hear about your frustrations with your lease takeover at the community. It was the worst timing for our phone line to go down, we're so sorry that we missed your applicants. I understand our manager is working with accounting to get this resolved for you. We wish you the best. Take care, Kailey

google_reviews.author: Nate Lloyd
google_reviews.review:
Changed my initial review after having lived here for a year.

Absolutely horrible!

My apartment was flooded from a hot water heater leak in the apartment above and they continued to charge me rent for the unlivable apartment while I arranged moving and found a new place while unable to walk because of an ankle surgery I had a few weeks earlier. So argumentative and money hungry. The maintenance crew is great, but management is horrible! Also raises rent by about 17% for the next year so I just count my ability to break the lease as a God send in the end! I'm glad to be rid of this overpriced and poorly maintained liability there are frequent parties until 3 am and was a drug overdose while I lived.

LOOK ELSEWHERE

google_reviews.author: Sarah Taylor
google_reviews.review: Management is like a rotating door through here. You're guaranteed to see an entirely different crew of people by the time you finish your lease. The apartments are cheaply made and fall apart. Don't fall for their "bundle utilities" scheme.Learn how to pay a utility bill and find an actually decent apartment for a fraction of the cost.

google_reviews.author: Rachel Sandal
google_reviews.review: Management and staff have been rude and somewhat unresponsive to our needs/questions. People have entered our apartment without any notice at all and it was scary! That experience left my roommates and I shaken up. In talking to the leasing office about our concerns, they have been rude and even threatened us with corporate lawyers. They have insinuated my roommate is unintelligent telling her that she just wouldnt understand the legal stuff. Its a good location, but honestly not worth it. I dont think anyone in the building is renewing their lease from our knowledge. We have had a horrible renters experience and will not be renting with this company again.

google_reviews.author: Debbie Schmidt
google_reviews.review:
Update:  More collections calls. I sent in all the proof I had explaining the situation and showing all the sites that currently show no availability. They are supposed to attempt to re rent the unit. Month after month it shows no availability but there was a unit available. They know I cannot pay this amount right now and we are paying the rent on the unit my son moved to so he could get out of the situation he was in. If you think renting from a WWU living building means they will care about your student at all, please continue reading our story below. If they don't care in this extreme situation and with all that is going on right now, just be warned, they will not help you.

Please do not let your student rent here! We are currently in the middle of a pandemic and I just got a collections call from these people.  My son was extremely sick and was tested for covid-19. My son was so sick and didn't feel safe since others in the apartment were angry about possibly getting the virus.  We had to quickly find him a new place to live and move him out.  I explained to the staff that he was moving out because he felt unsafe. They said the would send us a bill for the utilities for the month when they got them.  I heard nothing from them at all. And now a collections call wanting the entire balance of the lease NOW. During a pandemic when no one is working and I'm still paying rent where he is actually living.
This is a tiny expensive apartment with 4 tenants! They bring in over $2800 just for this apartment. Once the lease was signed it was down hill. And I know I'm foolish for believing the management when we moved him out. But since we all thought he had covid they seemed happy to have him go and understood why his roommates wouldn't want him there. The office staff wouldn't even open the door when he went to drop off the keys.
They are supposed to make a reasonable effort to rerent the room but apatment search sites say they have no availability.
Yes. I realized I signed a lease. But we picked this building because it was newer and looked safe.  He should expect to feel safe in his own apartment.
